FK.content: minimal trustworthiness of the word, like Heidegger’s Faktum
FK.linkedContent: minimal trustworthiness of the word, like Heidegger’s Faktum

FK.content: that which acquiesces prior to all questioning of spirit: trust/faith, Faktum, comprehension of “is” or “be” > [Heidegger’s last god?] this faith does not constitute a religion but is it untouched by religiosity? [see p. 67]
FK.linkedContent: that which acquiesces prior to all questioning of spirit: trust/faith, Faktum, comprehension of “is” or “be” > [Heidegger’s last god?] this faith does not constitute a religion but is it untouched by religiosity? [see p. 67]

FK.content: each time Heidegger uses Faktum (not empirical fact) led back to place where acquiescence is de rigueur
FK.linkedContent: each time Heidegger uses Faktum (not empirical fact) led back to place where acquiescence is de rigueur

OOG.content: for Husserl of “Philosophy of Rigorous Science,” singularity is “oneness of fact in its pure factuality,” eternally apeiron, excludes only, acc. Ricouer, empirical individuality, only ‘factuality’ > the tode ti of brute existence
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl of “Philosophy of Rigorous Science,” singularity is “oneness of fact in its pure factuality,” eternally apeiron, excludes only, acc. Ricouer, empirical individuality, only ‘factuality’ > the tode ti of brute existence

OOG.content: [like Hegel like Husserl] Logos is the pure movement of its own historicity, goes beyond “Fact” as the “ready-made” of history
OOG.linkedContent: [like Hegel like Husserl] Logos is the pure movement of its own historicity, goes beyond “Fact” as the “ready-made” of history

SPOM.content: techno-tele-media apparatuses don’t affect only the facts but concept of “facts”
SPOM.linkedContent: techno-tele-media apparatuses don’t affect only the facts but concept of “facts”

MPM.content: singular aporia that divides the act, can’t be mastered, commits us before any active commitment on our part, impossibility of promise, uncontrollable > faktum, “older”
MPM.linkedContent: singular aporia that divides the act, can’t be mastered, commits us before any active commitment on our part, impossibility of promise, uncontrollable > faktum, “older”

MPM.content: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this not natural “fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history
MPM.linkedContent: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this not natural “fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history

EM.content: Being acknowledged as fact (Faktum) by way of phenomenological determination [principle of principles, presence] of exemplary being, Dasein
EM.linkedContent: Being acknowledged as fact (Faktum) by way of phenomenological determination [principle of principles, presence] of exemplary being, Dasein

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum

VM.content: would return to intentional phenomenon acquiesce to violence of fact, is there thus an irreducible zone of factuality, an original, transcendental, preethical violence? > would it be tied to phenomenality itself & possibility of language? embedded in root of meaning & logos
VM.linkedContent: would return to intentional phenomenon acquiesce to violence of fact, is there thus an irreducible zone of factuality, an original, transcendental, preethical violence? > would it be tied to phenomenality itself & possibility of language? embedded in root of meaning & logos

VM.content: Husserl called irreducible egoic essence of experience “archi-factuality” (Urtatsache); p. 132 egological life has “living present” as irreducible absolutely universal form
VM.linkedContent: Husserl called irreducible egoic essence of experience “archi-factuality” (Urtatsache); p. 132 egological life has “living present” as irreducible absolutely universal form

VM.content: ontological/transcendental “priority” no more contradicts than confirms ontic/factual precedence
VM.linkedContent: ontological/transcendental “priority” no more contradicts than confirms ontic/factual precedence

VP.content: for Husserl, starting point in “Fatkum” of language not a presupposition so long as we’re attentive to contingency of example
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, starting point in “Fatkum” of language not a presupposition so long as we’re attentive to contingency of example

VP.content: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)
VP.linkedContent: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)

S.content: Heidegger: factitious existence “falls (fällt)” from originary temporality, from which it has its possibility
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: factitious existence “falls (fällt)” from originary temporality, from which it has its possibility

OH.content: “new censorship” combines concentration & fractionalization, accumulation & privatization > de-politicizes every informing of a “fact,” no information escapes
OH.linkedContent: “new censorship” combines concentration & fractionalization, accumulation & privatization > de-politicizes every informing of a “fact,” no information escapes

SH.content: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well
SH.linkedContent: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well

FWT.content: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]

SP.content: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]
SP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]

GSP.content: for [1st phase] phenomenology, all empiricism requires a prior [transcendental] regional circumscription of objectivity, not against all genetism, but certainly against skeptical “worldly genesis,” naturalism, causalism, positivism, science-of-facts (Tatsachenwissenschaft)
GSP.linkedContent: for [1st phase] phenomenology, all empiricism requires a prior [transcendental] regional circumscription of objectivity, not against all genetism, but certainly against skeptical “worldly genesis,” naturalism, causalism, positivism, science-of-facts (Tatsachenwissenschaft)

GSP.content: acc. Husserl, Dilthey’s Weltanschauungsphilosophie is a structural historicism, doesn’t avoid relativism or skepticism: confuses truth of facts w/ truths of reason [Leibniz’s terms]
GSP.linkedContent: acc. Husserl, Dilthey’s Weltanschauungsphilosophie is a structural historicism, doesn’t avoid relativism or skepticism: confuses truth of facts w/ truths of reason [Leibniz’s terms]

GSP.content: for Husserl, pure truth missed when accounted for in historical totality, finite totality, factual totality > truth must open to infinite idea (Kant), w/out any limits, absolute, universal
GSP.linkedContent: for Husserl, pure truth missed when accounted for in historical totality, finite totality, factual totality > truth must open to infinite idea (Kant), w/out any limits, absolute, universal

PS.content: re: Foucault, Derrida asks if fully historical field of interrogation [critical/clinical], would show us how something impossible de facto could present itself as impossible de jure [?]
PS.linkedContent: re: Foucault, Derrida asks if fully historical field of interrogation [critical/clinical], would show us how something impossible de facto could present itself as impossible de jure [?]

FS.content: for Rousset, in the “literary fact” language is one w/ meaning, form belongs to content of work > all possible via imagination’s capacity for metaphor, unifying “form and content”
FS.linkedContent: for Rousset, in the “literary fact” language is one w/ meaning, form belongs to content of work > all possible via imagination’s capacity for metaphor, unifying “form and content”

CHM.content: “the fact of language is probably the only fact ultimately to resist all parenthization” [letter arrives?]
CHM.linkedContent: “the fact of language is probably the only fact ultimately to resist all parenthization” [letter arrives?]

CHM.content: what is de facto and what de jure in relation to Cogito & madness?
CHM.linkedContent: what is de facto and what de jure in relation to Cogito & madness?

Gi.content: being-with does not arise from factical connection, a species-like unification (gattungshafte Zusammenstreben) “metaphysically presupposes” dissemination of Dasein, thus Mitsein
Gi.linkedContent: being-with does not arise from factical connection, a species-like unification (gattungshafte Zusammenstreben) “metaphysically presupposes” dissemination of Dasein, thus Mitsein

REST.content: Derrida’s “close reading,” a policing, “if police there is (and isn’t there always),” played out via the size (pointure) of a comma, that which separates “pair” (of shoes) from “the product” > not a temporal interval but a syntactic fact
REST.linkedContent: Derrida’s “close reading,” a policing, “if police there is (and isn’t there always),” played out via the size (pointure) of a comma, that which separates “pair” (of shoes) from “the product” > not a temporal interval but a syntactic fact

HLP.content: lying w/ images, “facts” structured by simulacrum/virtual, “live television,” by means of selective/interpretive performativity, destroys even reference to the alterity of what it replaces: produces indubitable “truth effect” > absolute lie can survive w/out anyone knowing
HLP.linkedContent: lying w/ images, “facts” structured by simulacrum/virtual, “live television,” by means of selective/interpretive performativity, destroys even reference to the alterity of what it replaces: produces indubitable “truth effect” > absolute lie can survive w/out anyone knowing

AFR.content: in Condillac, primacy of practical instinct invariable trait of new critical metaphysics: not philosophy of praxis but metaphysics of fact > general theory, de facto & de jure, presupposes scientific fact
AFR.linkedContent: in Condillac, primacy of practical instinct invariable trait of new critical metaphysics: not philosophy of praxis but metaphysics of fact > general theory, de facto & de jure, presupposes scientific fact

AFR.content: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]

AFR.content: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)

HST.content: Levinas: response to the hope for the present is the very expression of the“I,” exigency to redeem instant of despair; hope for present as a primary fact in mystery of time
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: response to the hope for the present is the very expression of the“I,” exigency to redeem instant of despair; hope for present as a primary fact in mystery of time

HST.content: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution
HST.linkedContent: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution

LI.content: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility
LI.linkedContent: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility

LI.content: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split
LI.linkedContent: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split

LI.content: classically, fact has been opposed to essence (or principle) > le procès juridico-théorique that leads to an essential definition
LI.linkedContent: classically, fact has been opposed to essence (or principle) > le procès juridico-théorique that leads to an essential definition

LI.content: Derrida does not ignore the profound/classical necessity of theoretical-methodological idealizations that isolates “serious literal speech” [Donald Trump]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida does not ignore the profound/classical necessity of theoretical-methodological idealizations that isolates “serious literal speech” [Donald Trump]

TN.content: Franck’s forced interpretation of Husserl places hyletic sensuality of flesh (contact, self-contact) before time: Franck overruns intentional analytic toward existential one, then overruns existential analytic > flesh opens time: archefacticity as con-tingency
TN.linkedContent: Franck’s forced interpretation of Husserl places hyletic sensuality of flesh (contact, self-contact) before time: Franck overruns intentional analytic toward existential one, then overruns existential analytic > flesh opens time: archefacticity as con-tingency

TN.content: Franck’s happy, lucky condensation of word con-tingency [used as alibi?]: contingere: touching, attaining, also happening (arriver), befalling (échoir), falling to one’s lot or part (tomber en partage): essential facticity of this evenementialité aléatoire resists eidetic variation
TN.linkedContent: Franck’s happy, lucky condensation of word con-tingency [used as alibi?]: contingere: touching, attaining, also happening (arriver), befalling (échoir), falling to one’s lot or part (tomber en partage): essential facticity of this evenementialité aléatoire resists eidetic variation

TN.content: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium
TN.linkedContent: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium

CIN.content: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus
CIN.linkedContent: cinder: doesn’t say what it is, but what it was (fut), remains in memory of departed (feu), all our lost etymologies, fatum, fuit, functus, defunctus

BSi.content: obligation to fellow, even if it’s a fact (can a fact ground, justify an ethics?), will never have founded a right, an ethics…
BSi.linkedContent: obligation to fellow, even if it’s a fact (can a fact ground, justify an ethics?), will never have founded a right, an ethics…

BSi.content: appeal to reason, a reason that is not one, as fact of name and force of the stronger
BSi.linkedContent: appeal to reason, a reason that is not one, as fact of name and force of the stronger

OG.content: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence
OG.linkedContent: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence

OG.content: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait
OG.linkedContent: trace is nothing, exceeds question “what is?” > no longer sheltered in grammatological knowledge: no longer assurance of opposition fait/droit > no pure fait

OG.content: via Lévi-Strauss, l’écart btwn factual certainty of incident & late night theoretical interpretation
OG.linkedContent: via Lévi-Strauss, l’écart btwn factual certainty of incident & late night theoretical interpretation

OG.content: Rousseau knows all factual illustrations of primitive presence are fictive [?], could care less about the facts
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau knows all factual illustrations of primitive presence are fictive [?], could care less about the facts

OG.content: for Rousseau, only philosophy can think catastrophic factum, which history (historians) can’t; passage can’t be explained structurally; chance, the “surprising,” not part of system, a free & mythic invention
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, only philosophy can think catastrophic factum, which history (historians) can’t; passage can’t be explained structurally; chance, the “surprising,” not part of system, a free & mythic invention

EU.content: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic
EU.linkedContent: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic

EU.content: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king
EU.linkedContent: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king

EU.content: Kant rationalizes necessity of censorship, constructs a schema of pure a priori rationality to justify a state of fact (fact of the State [like Hegel?])
EU.linkedContent: Kant rationalizes necessity of censorship, constructs a schema of pure a priori rationality to justify a state of fact (fact of the State [like Hegel?])

EU.content: metaphysics of morals deals w/ freedom not nature, rights & duty, to possess metaphysics is a duty > everyone has this metaphysics and thus this duty—a Faktum
EU.linkedContent: metaphysics of morals deals w/ freedom not nature, rights & duty, to possess metaphysics is a duty > everyone has this metaphysics and thus this duty—a Faktum

FV.content: Lacan’s emphasis on logos as phonē, writing relevé by voice, phonetic fact is only a fact w/in limits of “phonetic” systems of writing (beyond relation of de facto to de jure, Derrida interested in Lacan’s implied equivalence btwn symbolic articulation & phonematicity)
FV.linkedContent: Lacan’s emphasis on logos as phonē, writing relevé by voice, phonetic fact is only a fact w/in limits of “phonetic” systems of writing (beyond relation of de facto to de jure, Derrida interested in Lacan’s implied equivalence btwn symbolic articulation & phonematicity)
